dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, I was reading this wild article, and it started with Chris Hemsworth wearing like, a 70-pound fat suit for Thor? But then it just, uh, totally pivoted to Hollywood salaries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, I was reading this wild article, and it started with Chris Hemsworth wearing like, a seventy-pound fat suit for Thor? But then it just, uh, totally pivoted to Hollywood salaries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chris Hemsworth Wore a 70-Pound Fat Suit to Play Thor in Avengers A bankable leading man is still one of Hollywoods surest bets, even if your name isnt Leonardo DiCaprio.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] A fat suit? Wow. Okay, yeah, Hollywood salaries are always wild. What, uh, what's the scoop?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A fat suit? Wow. Okay, yeah, Hollywood salaries are always wild. What, uh, what's the scoop?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's about how these "bankable leading men" used to get those huge twenty-twenty deals â€“ you know, $20 million upfront, 20% of gross. That's actually, like, making a comeback.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the lucrative twenty-twenty deal ($20 million upfront and 20% of gross profit) doled out to the likes of Harrison Ford and Tom Cruise may be more or less gone, Hollywood still has its big-money brands...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the old Harrison Ford, Tom Cruise days! I thought that was, um, a thing of the past with all the franchise stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the old Harrison Ford, Tom Cruise days! I thought that was, um, a thing of the past with all the franchise stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but the big takeaway? Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is just crushing it. He was the highest-paid in 2019, pulling in almost $90 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but the big takeaway? Dwayne The Rock Johnson is just crushing it. He was the highest-paid in twenty nineteen, pulling in almost ninety million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dwayne Johnson, also known as the Rock, tops the Forbes list of the worlds ten highest-paid actors, collecting $89.4 million between June 1, 2018, and June 1, 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that's not surprising, though, is it? He's everywhere! But how does he do it? Is it just, like, a huge upfront salary?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's not surprising, though, is it? He's everywhere! But how does he do it? Is it just, like, a huge upfront salary?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Kinda, but it's more strategic. He gets a big upfront, sure, like $23.5 million for the new Jumanji. But then, he also gets up to 15% of the *pool* from his big franchises.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kinda, but it's more strategic. He gets a big upfront, sure, like twenty three point five million dollars for the new Jumanji. But then, he also gets up to fifteen percent of the pool from his big franchises.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hell collect an upfront salary of up to $23.5 millionhis highest quote yetfor the forthcoming Jumanji: The Next Level. He also commands up to 15% of the pool from high-grossing franchise movies...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the "pool" after, uh, some expenses are paid. Plus, he's got Ballers on HBO, and his Under Armour line. He's, like, a whole business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the pool after, uh, some expenses are paid. Plus, he's got Ballers on H B O, and his Under Armour line. He's, like, a whole business.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And he is paid $700,000 per episode for HBOs Ballers and seven figures in royalties for his line of clothing, shoes and headphones with Under Armour.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And compare that to someone like RDJ. He got $20 million upfront and 8% of the *Endgame* pool, which ended up being $55 million just for that one movie.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Robert Downey Jr. gets $20 million upfront and nearly 8% of the pool for his role as Iron Man, and that amounted to about $55 million for his work in Avengers: Endgame, which grossed $2.796 billion at the box office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wow, so that's what, uh, almost twice his upfront just from the back-end? That *Endgame* money was just insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, so that's what, uh, almost twice his upfront just from the back-end? That Endgame money was just insane.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But then you have, um, a really interesting case like Bradley Cooper. He was also on the list, like top six.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But then you have, um, a really interesting case like Bradley Cooper. He was also on the list, like top six.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, I saw that. Was that for Rocket Raccoon? I mean, he voiced it, but that's a big payday for a voice role.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, I saw that. Was that for Rocket Raccoon? I mean, he voiced it, but that's a big payday for a voice role.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, only 10% of his $57 million payday was from Rocket. Seventy percent actually came from *A Star Is Born*! He, like, directed, produced, co-wrote, and starred in it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, only ten percent of his fifty seven million dollar payday was from Rocket. Seventy percent actually came from A Star Is Born! He, like, directed, produced, co-wrote, and starred in it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [surprised] No way! So, he gambled on himself, basically? Put in his own, like, leverage, and it totally paid off?

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it was a passion project. The movie only cost $36 million to make and grossed $435 million, leaving him with an estimated $40 million profit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's, uh, incredible. It really shows how these big names, like Downey and Johnson too, have so much leverage now to really command these insane deals.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's not just about the upfront paycheck anymore. It's about, um, really strategic partnerships and understanding where the big money is.
